Module Simulator
Package kin.invkin.downhill

Class InverseKinematicsIterative

java.lang.Object
kin.invkin.downhill.InverseKinematicsIterative
All Implemented Interfaces:
InverseKinematics
Direct Known Subclasses:
InverseKinematicsIterativeWithStandServo
public class InverseKinematicsIterative
extends java.lang.Object
implements InverseKinematics
Inverse kinematics computations based on iterative approximation (downhill approach). This approach is useful for arbitrary manipulator configurations for which no closed solution exist.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    InverseKinematicsIterative​(Body body, DirectModelKinematics directKinematics)
    Create an object that provides inverse kinematics computation on servo angles and linear motor lengths based on downhill optimization.

  • Constructor Details

    • InverseKinematicsIterative

      public InverseKinematicsIterative​(Body body, DirectModelKinematics directKinematics)
      Create an object that provides inverse kinematics computation on servo angles and linear motor lengths based on downhill optimization.
      Parameters:
      body - the component including attached components
      directKinematics - the direct kinematics instance

  • Method Details

    • setInitialValues

      public void setInitialValues​(double[] initialValues, double[] initialDeltas)
      Define initial motor values and deltas for the optimization approach.
      Parameters:
      initialValues - same size as joints: for each motor, the initial value is used ; each element may be NaN – in this case the current motor value is used; entire array may be null
      initialDeltas - same size as joints: for each motor, the initial delta value is used; each element may be NaN – in this case pre-defined deltas are used; entire array may be null

    • getIKDescription

      Compute servo angles to reach a certain gripper position.
      Specified by:
      motorSettingsForPos in interface InverseKinematics
      Parameters:
      targetPos - the position to reach
      reference - the reference of the given vector, see DirectModelKinematics.REFERENCE_... constants
      Returns:
      the servo configuration to reach this position
